timeline.message: adjust routing to questions overview page

Merge branch 'develop' of https://github.com/ls1intum/Artemis into feature/questions-answers/overview

timeline.bodyText:
Is there a special reason for this subscription?
I think this.courseId = Number(this.route.snapshot.paramMap.get('courseId')); inside of the ngOnInit would be sufficient.
timeline.author: JonasPetry

replies.bodyText: I've just seen it done with the subscription in quite a few different places, but I like your suggestion better. It's a lot cleaner. I changed it now and thanks for the suggestion!
replies.author: filip-gregurevic

timeline.message:
Merge branch 'develop' of https://github.com/ls1intum/Artemis into feature/questions-answers/overview

# Conflicts:
#	src/test/java/de/tum/in/www1/artemis/util/DatabaseUtilService.java

timeline.bodyText: This still says exercise, is that correct?
timeline.author: FrankeLukas
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -179,7 +184,7 @@ public StudentQuestionResource(StudentQuestionRepository studentQuestionReposito
 
     /**
      *
-     * GET /lectures/{lectureId}/student-questions : get all student questions for exercise.
+     * GET /lectures/{lectureId}/student-questions : get all student questions for lecture.
      * @param lectureId the lecture that the student questions belong to
      * @return the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK) and with body all student questions for exercise

replies.bodyText: No, I changed it to lecture since it is the endpoint to get the questions for a lecture. Must have been forgotten when copy-pasting.
replies.author: filip-gregurevic

timeline.author: FrankeLukas
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -200,6 +205,28 @@ public StudentQuestionResource(StudentQuestionRepository studentQuestionReposito
         return new ResponseEntity<>(studentQuestions, null, HttpStatus.OK);
     }
 
+    /**
+     *
+     * GET /courses/{courseId}/student-questions : get all student questions for course.
+     * @param courseId the course that the student questions belong to
+     * @return the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK) and with body all student questions for exercise

replies.bodyText: I changed it to say course instead of exercise now.
replies.author: filip-gregurevic

timeline.bodyText: The other similar calls use hideSensitiveInformation here. Was that intentionally left out for the course questions?
timeline.author: FrankeLukas

replies.bodyText: @FrankeLukas  This is mostly used to hide information students shouldn't be able to see. In this case no such information is sent and the endpoint is only accessible for tutors and instructors.
replies.author: filip-gregurevic
